header: CNR­MHPU01­000922­2019 CNR­MHPU01­001045­2019 COMMON ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLN NO. 258/2019 AND 319/2019 Perused the bail application of Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera and Lakhansingh Ranbirsing Dudhani and say thereon.

background.text: Perused case diary. Heard the learned Advocate Shri. Bhoite for the applicant / accused Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera and learned Counsel Shri Talukdar for the applicant / accused Lakhansing Ranbirsing Dudhani and APP Shri. Salvi for the State. 2] It is the case of the Prosecution that on 17.11.2018 at 9.00 to 9.30 p.m., on road in front of Plot No. E/44 and Plot No. E/45 Market Yard, Pune 37, accused Ranbirsingh Dudhani, Lakhansingh Dudhani and one unknown boy assaulted complainant Bhauahe Khengare and his brother by means of wooden bamboo and thereby committed an offence punishable under Sec/s. 307, 388, 326, 325, 143, 147, 148, 149, 504 of Indian Penal Code and under Section 37(1)(3) / 135 of Maharashtra Police Act which registered as CR No. 200/2018 with Market Yard Police Station.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under sec/s. 307, 388, 326, 325, 143, 147, 148, 149, 504 of indian penal code
under section 37(1)(3) / 135 of maharashtra police act

legalAct.actShortNameList: Bombay Police Act,Mumbai Police Act,Maharashtra Police Act,B. P.Act,B.P.Act,B.P. Act.

arguments.text: 3] The learned Counsel Shri. Bhoite for the applicant Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera submitted that 2 CNR­MHPU01­000922­2019 CNR­MHPU01­001045­2019 applicant is arrested on 07.01.2019. His name and role does not figure in FIR. There was no motive, intention, preparation or knowledge. Nothing is recovered from the applicant. There are no antecedents recorded in his name.

argumentSentences.text: 3] The learned Counsel Shri.
Bhoite for the applicant Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera submitted that 2 CNR­MHPU01­000922­2019 CNR­MHPU01­001045­2019 applicant is arrested on 07.01.2019.
His name and role does not figure in FIR.
There was no motive, intention, preparation or knowledge.
Nothing is recovered from the applicant.
There are no antecedents recorded in his name.

arguments.text: 4] The learned Counsel Shri. Talukdar for the applicant Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera submitted that wooden stick is recovered. On the same day injured had discharged from the hopsital. At the most offence punishable u/S 325 of Indian Penal Code may attract. Co­accused Yogesh Gujanla is released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 4] The learned Counsel Shri.
Talukdar for the applicant Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera submitted that wooden stick is recovered.
On the same day injured had discharged from the hopsital.
At the most offence punishable u/S 325 of Indian Penal Code may attract.
Co­accused Yogesh Gujanla is released on bail.

arguments.text: 5] Learned APP Shri. Salvi submitted that Deepali had received four grievous injuries on her person, whereas, Vitthalrao has received two grievous injuries. Bamboo stick is recovered from applicant Lakhasing Dudhani. Nothing is recovered from accused Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan. So also, his name does not figure in FIR. Injureds are discharged from the hospital and they are out of danger. There is delay of 3 days to FIR. Yogesh Gunjale is already released on bail by order dt. 09.01.2019. As injureds are discharged from the hospital on the very day of the admission from the hospital, in my view there is no possibility that the offence would turn into serious one. Hence, in my view further custody of the applicants is not required. As such, I proceed to pass following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Learned APP Shri.
Salvi submitted that Deepali had received four grievous injuries on her person, whereas, Vitthalrao has received two grievous injuries.
Bamboo stick is recovered from applicant Lakhasing Dudhani.
Nothing is recovered from accused Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan.
So also, his name does not figure in FIR.
Injureds are discharged from the hospital and they are out of danger.
There is delay of 3 days to FIR.
Yogesh Gunjale is already released on bail by order dt.
As injureds are discharged from the hospital on the very day of the admission from the hospital, in my view there is no possibility that the offence would turn into serious one.
Hence, in my view further custody of the applicants is not required.
As such, I proceed to pass following order.

order.text: ORDER Accused Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera and Lakhansingh Ranbirsing Dudhani be enlarged on PR Bond of Rs. 20,000/­ each with one or two sureties each in like amount on following conditions. 1] They shall remain present before the Court on each and every date for facing trial. 2] They shall not tamper the prosecution evidence and they shall maintain peace in the society. 3] They shall not commit any other or further offence. 4] In default any of the condition bail shall automatically forfeited to the Government without notice to the accused. 5] Copy of this order be attached with Criminal bail appln No. 319/2019. 2] Bail before concerned Court.

footer: Sd/­­­­­­­­ Pune. processedText:
CNR­MHPU01­000922­2019 CNR­MHPU01­001045­2019 COMMON ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLN NO. 258/2019 AND 319/2019 Perused the bail application of Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera and Lakhansingh Ranbirsing Dudhani and say thereon. 
---header-ends---
Perused case diary. Heard the learned Advocate Shri. Bhoite for the applicant / accused Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera and learned Counsel Shri Talukdar for the applicant / accused Lakhansing Ranbirsing Dudhani and APP Shri. Salvi for the State. 2] It is the case of the Prosecution that on 17.11.2018 at 9.00 to 9.30 p.m., on road in front of Plot No. E/44 and Plot No. E/45 Market Yard, Pune 37, accused Ranbirsingh Dudhani, Lakhansingh Dudhani and one unknown boy assaulted complainant Bhauahe Khengare and his brother by means of wooden bamboo and thereby committed an offence punishable under Sec/s. 307, 388, 326, 325, 143, 147, 148, 149, 504 of Indian Penal Code and under Section 37(1)(3) / 135 of Maharashtra Police Act which registered as CR No. 200/2018 with Market Yard Police Station. 
---background-ends---
3] The learned Counsel Shri. Bhoite for the applicant Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera submitted that 2 CNR­MHPU01­000922­2019 CNR­MHPU01­001045­2019 applicant is arrested on 07.01.2019. His name and role does not figure in FIR. There was no motive, intention, preparation or knowledge. Nothing is recovered from the applicant. There are no antecedents recorded in his name. 
---argument-ends---
4] The learned Counsel Shri. Talukdar for the applicant Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera submitted that wooden stick is recovered. On the same day injured had discharged from the hopsital. At the most offence punishable u/S 325 of Indian Penal Code may attract. Co­accused Yogesh Gujanla is released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
5] Learned APP Shri. Salvi submitted that Deepali had received four grievous injuries on her person, whereas, Vitthalrao has received two grievous injuries. Bamboo stick is recovered from applicant Lakhasing Dudhani. Nothing is recovered from accused Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan. So also, his name does not figure in FIR. Injureds are discharged from the hospital and they are out of danger. There is delay of 3 days to FIR. Yogesh Gunjale is already released on bail by order dt. 09.01.2019. As injureds are discharged from the hospital on the very day of the admission from the hospital, in my view there is no possibility that the offence would turn into serious one. Hence, in my view further custody of the applicants is not required. As such, I proceed to pass following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER Accused Vivek @ Chintu Ashok Chavan/Lavera and Lakhansingh Ranbirsing Dudhani be enlarged on PR Bond of Rs. 20,000/­ each with one or two sureties each in like amount on following conditions. 1] They shall remain present before the Court on each and every date for facing trial. 2] They shall not tamper the prosecution evidence and they shall maintain peace in the society. 3] They shall not commit any other or further offence. 4] In default any of the condition bail shall automatically forfeited to the Government without notice to the accused. 5] Copy of this order be attached with Criminal bail appln No. 319/2019. 2] Bail before concerned Court. 
---order-ends---
